_description: Two proverbial couplets, translating, ‘Cum procor, est aurum cirothecis…’

BodDou52.Editions:
Förster,  Max. 
             “Die Mittelenglische Sprichwörtersammlung in Douce 52.” 
             Festschrift zum XII Deutschen Neuphilolgentage in München
                1906.
            E. Stollreither, ed. 
         Erlangen (1906): 40-64: 55.

CULIi38.Transcription: Wyle ihc þe woueGolden þi gloue & c[etera]
CULIi38.Editions:
Stemmler,  Theo. 
             “More English Texts from MS. Cambridge University Library
                Ii.III.8.” 
             Anglia
         93 (1975): 1-16: 3.

CULKk424.Transcription:
Whyle þat y wowe gold yn my glouewhan y haue þat y
                    wylgoddes grame on þy byl

DurCathBI18.Transcription:
to wyles hi þe wochegold in þi glouewen hi haue
                    þat hi wilegode greme hi þi bile
DurCathBI18.Note:
Written as prose, embedded in Latin prose Summa de vii viciis of
                    Thomas Aquinas.

RylandsLat394.Transcription:
When þat I wowegoold is in my glove I noweWhen I haue
                    þat I wyllgoddes grame on þy bylle
RylandsLat394.Note:
Written as two lines, trans. ‘Cum procor est aurum cirotecis
                        vndique staurum…’, which follows.
RylandsLat394.Editions:
Pantin,  William A. 
             “A Medieval Collection of Latin and English Proverbs…from Rylands
                Latin MS. 394.” 
             Bulletin of the John Rylands Library
         14 (1930): 81-114: 105.
